plaintiff.name: EMAN YOUSSEF
plaintiff.residency: State of New York, borough of Manhattan
plaintiff.consumer_status: Individual 'consumer' under FCRA and NY FCRA

defendants.name: TD BANK, N.A.
defendants.business_status: Authorized to do business in New York

defendants.name: EQUIFAX INFORMATION SERVICES, LLC
defendants.business_status: Authorized to do business in New York

defendants.business_status: Authorized to do business in New York

defendants.name: TRANS UNION, LLC
defendants.business_status: Authorized to do business in New York

preliminary_statement.overview: Plaintiff brings this action against Defendants for violating the FCRA and NY FCRA by failing to reasonably investigate fraudulent charges and continuing to report inaccurate information.
key_claims: Identity theft victim while traveling abroad
TD Bank failed to investigate fraudulent charges after dispute
Credit reporting agencies failed to conduct reasonable investigations
Plaintiff suffered damages from inaccurate credit reporting

factual_background.summary: Plaintiff, a victim of identity theft while traveling abroad, disputed fraudulent charges with defendant TD Bank, who failed to reasonably investigate. The defendant credit reporting agencies subsequently failed to correct her credit reports, leading to significant financial and emotional damages.
allegations: Plaintiff opened a TD Bank credit card on or around July 2023 with an $8,000 credit limit
Plaintiff travelled to Egypt with her family from June 30, 2024 through July 30, 2024
Before leaving, Plaintiff informed TD Bank of her trip and verified her cards would work in Egypt
Plaintiff had two physical cards and brought both to Egypt
Imposters used her account to make over $7,700 in fraudulent charges between July 15-31, 2024
Majority of charges were made at three different camera stores on July 17, 23, and 26
Plaintiff had never made similar significant purchases in the past
Plaintiff disputed charges with TD Bank five times using multiple methods
TD Bank wrongly suggested her non-existent son made the charges
Plaintiff filed a police report and obtained video footage of the thieves
TD Bank refused to correct charges, insisting they were valid due to chip usage
Plaintiff sent written disputes to all three credit reporting agencies on December 9, 2024
Credit reporting agencies forwarded disputes to TD Bank who merely verified the amounts
Each credit reporting agency failed to conduct reasonable investigation
All defendant credit reporting agencies continue to inaccurately report the fraudulent charges

causes_of_action.title: FIRST CAUSE OF ACTION: Violation of the FCRA

legal_claims.description: Failure to conduct reasonable reinvestigations of the plaintiff's disputes of erroneous and derogatory payment information
Failure to review and consider all relevant information submitted by the plaintiff regarding her disputes
Failure to delete or modify disputed erroneous and derogatory payment information after failing to verify completeness and accuracy
Failure to conduct reasonable reinvestigations of plaintiff's disputes of erroneous and derogatory information
Failure to review all relevant information provided by the consumer reporting agencies in conducting reinvestigations

causes_of_action.title: SECOND CAUSE OF ACTION: Violation of the NY FCRA

legal_claims.description: Including known erroneous information in consumer reports
Failure to conduct reasonable reinvestigations of plaintiff's disputes of erroneous and derogatory payment information
Failure to delete or modify disputed information after failing to verify completeness and accuracy

injunctive_relief: An injunction requiring CRA defendants to remove erroneous information
Implementation of policies to ensure future compliance with NY FCRA
Prevention of similar errors in the future
